DOC.detailed_description: The APACC Study prospect , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled multicentre clinical trial design test efficacy regular low-dose aspirin administration reduce recurrence rate colorectal adenomatous polyp . The study involve 49 gastroenterology center various part France . Patients eligible either least 3 adenomas irrespective size , least one measure 6mm diameter histologically confirm colorectal adenomatous polyp local pathologist , 2 independent pathologist , underwent complete colonoscopy polypectomy confirm free polyp , age 18 75 year recruitment , able conform protocol study period . During 4-week run-in period enrolment , subject take 300 mg aspirin per day test tolerance compliance treatment . They randomize either follow three group : placebo , aspirin acetylsalicylate lysine 160 mg/day aspirin acetylsalicylate lysine 300 mg/day . Information compliance , tolerance treatment concomitant disease obtain regular clinical visit every 4 month . Informations factor smock habit , previous medical history record enrollment . The primary outcome define proportion subject least one new adenoma detect , adenomatous polyp burden calculate sum diameter adenomas follow-up colonoscopy 1 4 year enrollment .
